intro: Moraea pubiflora subsp. brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and striking, showy flowers. The flowers typically feature a pale blue to violet coloration with prominent yellow markings, and they bloom in late winter to early spring. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter floral tube compared to other varieties within the species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
